speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I have served Prince Florizell and in my time wore

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: three-pile, but now I am out of service.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: My traffic is sheets. When the kite builds, look to

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: lesser linen. My father named me Autolycus, who,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: being, as I am, littered under Mercury, was likewise

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: a snapper-up of unconsidered trifles. With die and

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: drab I purchased this caparison, and my revenue is

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: the silly cheat. Gallows and knock are too powerful

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: on the highway. Beating and hanging are terrors to

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: me. For the life to come, I sleep out the thought of

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: it. A prize, a prize!

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Let me see, every ’leven wether tods,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: every tod yields pound and odd shilling; fifteen

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: hundred shorn, what comes the wool to?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: If the springe hold, the cock’s

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: mine.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I cannot do ’t without counters. Let

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: me see, what am I to buy for our sheep-shearing

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text:
feast?
                 
                (
                He
                 
                reads
                 
                a
                 
                paper
                .
                )
               Three pound of sugar,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: five pound of currants, rice—what will this sister of

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: mine do with rice? But my father hath made her

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: mistress of the feast, and she lays it on. She hath

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: made me four-and-twenty nosegays for the shearers,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: three-man song men all, and very good ones;

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: but they are most of them means and basses, but

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: one Puritan amongst them, and he sings psalms to

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: hornpipes. I must have saffron to color the warden

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: pies; mace; dates, none, that’s out of my note;

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: nutmegs, seven; a race or two of ginger, but that I

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: may beg; four pound of prunes, and as many of

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: raisins o’ th’ sun.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: O, that ever I was

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: born!

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I’ th’ name of me!

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: O, help me, help me! Pluck but off these

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: rags, and then death, death.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Alack, poor soul, thou hast need of

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: more rags to lay on thee rather than have these off.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: O sir, the loathsomeness of them offends

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: me more than the stripes I have received, which are

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: mighty ones and millions.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Alas, poor man, a million of beating

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: may come to a great matter.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I am robbed, sir, and beaten, my money

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: and apparel ta’en from me, and these detestable

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: things put upon me.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: What, by a horseman, or a footman?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: A footman, sweet sir, a footman.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Indeed, he should be a footman by

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: the garments he has left with thee. If this be a

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: horseman’s coat, it hath seen very hot service. Lend

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: me thy hand; I’ll help thee. Come, lend me thy

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: hand.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: O, good sir, tenderly, O!

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Alas, poor soul.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: O, good sir, softly, good sir. I fear, sir, my

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: shoulder blade is out.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: How now? Canst stand?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Softly,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: dear sir, good sir, softly. You ha’ done me a charitable

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: office.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Dost lack any money? I have a little

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: money for thee.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: No, good sweet sir, no, I beseech you, sir. I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: have a kinsman not past three-quarters of a mile

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: hence, unto whom I was going. I shall there have

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: money or anything I want. Offer me no money, I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: pray you; that kills my heart.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: What manner of fellow was he that

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: robbed you?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: A fellow, sir, that I have known to go about

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: with troll-my-dames. I knew him once a servant of

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: the Prince. I cannot tell, good sir, for which of his

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: virtues it was, but he was certainly whipped out of

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: the court.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: His vices, you would say. There’s no

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: virtue whipped out of the court. They cherish it to

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: make it stay there, and yet it will no more but abide.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Vices, I would say, sir. I know this man

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: well. He hath been since an ape-bearer, then a

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: process-server, a bailiff. Then he compassed a motion

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: of the Prodigal Son, and married a tinker’s wife

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: within a mile where my land and living lies, and,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: having flown over many knavish professions, he

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: settled only in rogue. Some call him Autolycus.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Out upon him! Prig, for my life, prig!

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: He haunts wakes, fairs, and bearbaitings.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Very true, sir: he, sir, he. That’s the rogue

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: that put me into this apparel.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Not a more cowardly rogue in all

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Bohemia. If you had but looked big and spit at him,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: he’d have run.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I must confess to you, sir, I am no fighter. I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: am false of heart that way, and that he knew, I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: warrant him.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: How do you now?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Sweet sir, much better than I was. I can

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: stand and walk. I will even take my leave of you and

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: pace softly towards my kinsman’s.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Shall I bring thee on the way?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: No, good-faced sir, no, sweet sir.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Then fare thee well. I must go buy

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: spices for our sheep-shearing.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Prosper you, sweet sir.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Your purse is not hot enough to purchase your

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: spice. I’ll be with you at your sheep-shearing too. If

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I make not this cheat bring out another, and the

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: shearers prove sheep, let me be unrolled and my

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: name put in the book of virtue.
